website_summaries.verdict: If you’ve not upgraded your router in a while – or your ISP is too stingy to send you a newer up-to-date model – then the Tenda AC10U AC1200 might be what you need while you’re waiting to switch services. It’s very reasonably priced, and easy to set up and use, too.

customer_reviews.title: Diamond in the rough
customer_reviews.text: Have a virgin superhub 3, WiFi died bought a router, only to find that my wired connection was now only 100m/bit needed a gigabit router so did a search and found the Tenda. TLDR plugged in and now have WiFi at top of garden and in loft oh and the speeds are awesome, the Tenda management app on Android is perfect for fiddling away from home. Would highly recommend this as an alternative to the god awful super hub 3.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I used this to extend range of my virgin hub 3 so I could get WiFi on the garden. I've got my hub 3 in the front living room and I've put this router in the upstairs back bedroom and connected it as an access point opposed to a router. As a result, I've now got full speed download all around the house where previously signal would be poor in bathroom and back bedroom. Also I now get a range all the way to the end of my garden which is about 25m from the router and can still download at around 60mbps. It's effectively made a mesh system without the expense of one
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wood

customer_reviews.title: I cannot recommend this due to one flaw with DHCP Server.
customer_reviews.text: DHCP server automatically enables on this unit no matter what you do (AP Mode or not). If you turn it off and reboot, it stays off then after about 1 minute it logs you out of the web page and when you go back to the LAN settings, DHCP server is back on! I had purchase 3 of these for my house and my vdsl modem already is the DHCP Server. Last firmware update 2018! Other than that I was impressed by its price and basic design.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, less than 2 minutes and amazing performance. 20MB download speed wired and about 16MB on WiFi. Used to be connected to my Virgin Media WiFi but the signal was weak in some parts of the house, at times, it even disconnected but not with this bad boy. Full signal in almost every corner of the house and no lower speeds than 4MB( 4MB recored In back garden - 15 meters away from router)
customer_reviews.author: ROB

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace my netgear router that keeps losing all WiFi connections. However when I tried to install it there was no socket for a phone line. This meant I had to keep my original router to act as a modem, then connected them to each other via a Ethernet cable (supplied). This means that this router is being used as a signal extender and in this role has performed perfectly so far.
customer_reviews.author: G Radestock

customer_reviews.title: Really outshines the more expensive models
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews for products unless they surpass expectations and this one does. Pairing with my virgin router I am getting lossless output from this unassuming little router. The WiFi range is very good, I have all solid walls in my house and can pick it up at the furthest point away from the router, pulling over 30mbps from my 100mbps fibre and pulling the same as the virgin router when closer, which is usually around 115mbps. Over a cabled connection I am getting the same 115mbps. All this from a £40 router. Well done Tenda.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Bought to improve range of Virgin hub
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to improve the range of my Virgin hub. It does a great job and is a huge improvement. My wifi signal upstairs, in every room, is now strong. My only issue with set up was having to use a laptop as you initially need a wired connection to the router to set it up. My PC is in a separate room, so it caused a small issue. However, this was an easy fix and has greatly improved the wifi connection across the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: Great little router
customer_reviews.text: I invested over £150 in an all singing all dancing Asus router, just after a year it gave up the ghost so I needed a replacement. I wasn't prepared to fork out a fortune so bought this. I have a virgin hub 3, people say they're useless, but if you now what your doing with manual settings it's pretty good. So this router is to extend the wireless network. The router is easy to set up, one button selection to connect up to an existing wireless network, connected first time. Good strong signal, 10 mins to unbox and get connected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Signal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this wireless router to replace an old one which only had the 2.4 GHz bands. Signal strength on the new was poor when compared with the old on 2.4GHz and even worse on the 5GHz. Reurned the router and purchased an Asus replacement which gives me the full broadband speed from the isp on the 5GHz band.
customer_reviews.author: dw

customer_reviews.title: Kids on/off internet
customer_reviews.text: Bought it just to be able to control internet for children. A bit expensive purchase just for that but i couldn't figure out better way. after having it for 6 months I return it as controlled devices, when tenda switch them off/on internet, have trouble connecting again and have to go through set up mode again. Even echo devices loose connection for no reason. really annoying
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately wasn't able to carry a strong Wi-Fi signal from downstairs up to my room...
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this to connect and use as an access point in conjunction with my terrible Sky Q Hub to see if I can get a decent signal going upstairs but unfortunately no luck... I've connected to the 5Ghz network on this router upstairs and I am still only getting 10Mb/s download and frequent drop offs... If It's possible to get this working better by replacing my Sky Q Hub entirely I would like to try that but unfortunately I don't know how do do such things. Will be contacting sky tomorrow to see what the problem is with my internet. Seeing as this wasn't able to sort my issues out I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kinsella

customer_reviews.title: I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy!!!!!!! I have being trying to get this router up and running for like 2 days now and no luck. I can't get it to connect to my main router and neither can i connect to this router inorder to configure it. Configuration manually is just in another world; it makes it look simple but it's absolute useless, am going to give this router the last chance and after that I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Misleading and poor real world performance.
customer_reviews.text: After running the router for several days the WiFi drop outs are horrific. To the point were the router isn't fit for purpose. This router has so much potential but unfortunately I believe most of the claims are misleading at best with no real quality to the WiFi offering. I've ordered a replacement DLink router as I have learnt that it's best to stick with the big brands.
customer_reviews.author: Alex O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Far better than the stock Plusnet Router
customer_reviews.text: I have this connected to a TP Link Powerline in the bedroom as the stock Plusnet router I have in the living room is useless and most devices disconnect outside of a 6-10 metre radius (yes that bad). Plugged it in, turned on and set itself up straight away. I get a better connection throughout the house with this than the Plusnet router and a more stable connection. Wish i'd have considered this earlier rather than eating through mobile data but for under £15 it's perfect. For an above average user of the internet i'm not sure what more you could get without paying considerably more.
customer_reviews.author: M. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Beats virgin hub 3 no problems
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a replacement for you virgin hub. This works perfectly and worth every penny, We have had no connection problems over three floor and this being on the bottom floor. I had the max 25 connections on the hub3 and it was kicking random things off. And you have to reboot to get them to work. If that’s your problem this is the answer 👍
customer_reviews.author: pye

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement to the virgin media hub 3.0
customer_reviews.text: I was a little unsure of this when purchasing. Basing the purchase on the previous reviews about it improving virgin media internet instead of the Hub 3.0 (making the hub 3.0 work purely as a modem) Once set up (three days ago) the internet has been so much better, maybe even faultless. The router settings are better, the app for iPhone is great for checking devices and settings. The speeds are as expected and consistent. I’d recommend this for the money. A lot of the other competitors seemed a lot more money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Homer

customer_reviews.title: Parental control and device blacklisting doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The parental control on this does not work properly, sometimes it will control access and sometimes it won't. Disappointed as this is the reason I bought it but unfortunately I do not have all the packaging still so I can't really send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Wi-Fi has been rock solid with much better range compared to my Virgin Hub 3. Wall mounting it seemed to have made positive impact to the range too. App is useful although to access full functionality you have to login via a Web browser. For the price still all good months later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: The signal strength is better than. virgin Superhub 3, but not amazingly so. If I was trying again I would spend a bit extra. The built in VPN is nice, although the protocols it can do is very limited and the processor chip is not fast enough for the encryption needed. . Being able to turn of the light and perform an automatic daily reboot are nice. Overall, it is solid, but not spectularly better than a free one from an ISP.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely excellent
customer_reviews.text: This router is crazy good for its price point. I currently have 20 items connected, I am downloading 15gb of torrents on a 12mb connection and I'm still able to stream Netflix/YouTube/Plex (both my own server and remote server) Took only maybe 10 minutes to set up, instructions say to connect LAN of the tenda to WAN of your current modem but this is incorret it is the other way around. If it's sitting in your cart and you're hesitant to purchase it just go ahead and do it. You won't have any regrets.
customer_reviews.author: marie r kane

customer_reviews.title: Site blocking and access control not working
customer_reviews.text: Basic router, but advertised "with site blocking feature". After installation and connection as wisp - work as expected regarding speed and WiFi range. NOT WORKING SITE BLOCKING / FILTERING. from access control works only access to the internet by schedule, but is another limitation, only two group - unlimited and limited access. This means all limited devices have the same limitations. I was paid ~£10 this router is not wort even £10.
customer_reviews.author: Marcin Zyla

customer_reviews.title: Well.. that was a bit of a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: After reading loads of reviews and searching about, this one kept coming up with good reviews and best budget buy. But i've had nothing but issues with it.. dropping connections, restarting itself. its just annoying. I'm due to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Aimar

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Set Virgin hub 3 to modem mode (purple light) this thing will not gain internet access no matter what I try. Its going straight back to Amazon. I don't think it would have lasted long anyway as it is made of the cheapest plastic.
customer_reviews.author: mocctl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Just the job.
customer_reviews.text: Believe the positive reviews. This thing can’t be beat for the price. Bought it as our new Sky Hub and associated booster just aren’t up to the job. This is great. Coverage all over the house and out to the garage too.
customer_reviews.author: TNM

customer_reviews.title: Tenda AC10U AC1200
customer_reviews.text: Very good just remember to put your old router into modem mode first then connect your old router to the new via Wan Ethernet port and both routers after 5 minuets now connect all you cables into the new Tanda router your done! this work well and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nutbrown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase - Wifi now strong and fast
customer_reviews.text: Virgin wifi on the superhub 3 getting weaker and weaker. Purchased this as getting failures to connect when main PC is 2m from the Virgin hub. Easy to set up and the interface is very fast. It is quick and easy to make changes. Excellent features where you can limit children's times on their devices, and more than anything, easy to do. Wifi is strong and speed is fast.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Cheap as chips
customer_reviews.text: Seems a pretty decent router for the price. Time will tell if it keeps working. But for a router in this price range you cant go wrong. Its only usiong 2.4 for the wifi but thats fine for what I will be using it for, basically using it as a WiFi AP. More than happy with it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent basic features and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: An excellent router with some good feature for the price paid. Not complicated, easy to use, not for very advance users. However, some advance options are not available, such as firewall rules and DNS blocking.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Good product A**
customer_reviews.text: — Good product for the price picks up xbox 360, PS3 all older devices with low range and iphone XR no probs. — Speed given out is good and also having ethernet ports is a bouns. — Easy to configure between different modes with basic tech/network knowledge. — I would recommend this product depending on your use if want something with a-bit more up n go For online gaming etc n probs buy 600mbps by same company n product. This is ideal for Netflix,YouTube internet searching etc.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Simple WiFi Repeater set up
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe how easy this was to set up! I have been struggling trying to extend my WiFi to my shed with another router with no luck at all. Saw this and thought I would give it a go and was pleasantly surprised to see a Repeater setting on it, clicked on it and a couple of mouse swipes later it was done, so simple and I now have a great signal in my shed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant router
customer_reviews.text: Wow amazing router, rings the internet speeds everywhere you need. If you on Gigaclear I would really recomend this router
customer_reviews.author: simonbull

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality from 15mbps to 45-50 mbps in the upstairs bedrooms Really pleased with this product brilliant no crap sky internet with this wireless router in portadown co.Armagh northern Ireland..
customer_reviews.author: barry fluke

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, cost effective.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this device in two locations, one was to boost a weak signal, the other to boost a signal at a static caravan. It exceeded my expectations on both occasions, simple to set up, love the multi wireless option.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Great little router, very poor delivery!
customer_reviews.text: Good router, terrible delivery!! Had it delivered to work, but driver just handed the package to a visitor, very lucky they were honest and passed it on to our Reception. Using this as a wired access point. Connected it to laptop using network cable, set it to AP mode in the configuration page, rebooted and the plugged it into my main router. Connected to the new wireless network, setup WiFi security and password, all went really well.
customer_reviews.author: holloway275

customer_reviews.title: Not bad as a AP - software is ok
customer_reviews.text: Picked this as another option was out of stock at the time. Not bad for the money medium/ medium high coverage in my house and some rear garden. Worth the money as an access point as you get the extra ports aswell. Dedicated AP's are usually more ££
customer_reviews.author: Mr CCTV

customer_reviews.title: Poor WiFi reliability
customer_reviews.text: Bought on basis of other reviews. Used with virgin superhub 3 to improve WiFi. Although the range appears better with this hub and WiFi connection was lost every 24hrs needing a router reboot. It may have been a faulty unit but returned to Amazon for a full refund. I have gone back to my tenda powerlines for a more stable but slower connection.
customer_reviews.author: F Siddiqui

customer_reviews.title: 10X better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm am blown away how well this works. I live in a 4 floor maisonette with very thick walls and i get signal throughout. A massive Improvement from the router provided by hyperoptic. As for setup even better. Just plugged in and away it went. Even simple things like editing the ssid and password is so straight forward. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Af

customer_reviews.title: Solved our WiFi problems in the home.
customer_reviews.text: This has done the job, and done it well. Upstairs we have quite a few deadspots in regards to WiFi, so after checking what WiFi routers were available I decided on this one. I've ran a cable from my broadband providers router to the upstairs, plugged this in and it runs great! In my bedroom I was getting around 17Mbps but as you can see from the picture I'm now getting between 180 - 200Mbps. Really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Luigi_s_s

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a couple of these for me and one for family and they are both great and still going strong after adding a small 5 port network switch (just for extra wired connections)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Amazed how easy to set up for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this today as it seems quiet a few are on virgin with the hub 3 I live in a 2 bedroom flat in the second room I had to run a network cable due to the poor signal. I could not use the virgin box for Netflix or prime in the room due to poor signal. Took 5 minutes to swap the hub 3 into modem mode and signed into the new router changed the passwords and set up the virgin box now got 100% signal which was down at 23% before. Brilliant for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unable to connect
customer_reviews.text: Added to virgin hub 3, to start with it was good, but everyday 1 or more devices can’t connect to WiFi, so I have to restart the modem, no help whatsoever from Tenda, replaced by Amazon but second one still does this.
customer_reviews.author: MR R W

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant value
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the router for the price. Range is superb with quite a few devices connected, and speeds have been excellent. Pleased it also had a function to import the ISP login from my old Plusnet router.
customer_reviews.author: sOuP

customer_reviews.title: How to fix Virgin Media wifi
customer_reviews.text: We plugged this into our Virgin V6 box and pointed all our wireless devices at it - suddenly everything works. Something Virgin have failed to achieve on many occasions. Device was easy to install with clear password on base. We now have good reception in all corners of the house. Delivery was less than a day - well packaged safe and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I needed a better router for my Plusnet broadband, and was a little sceptical about this because of the price. I went for it, and do not regret it. Signal strength is great, set up was easy. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Lees

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with Virgin Hub 3
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these routers as access points around the house to extend the signal from my Virgin Hub 3. I changed the IP on both (which was easy) to stop conflicts with my current box and followed the steps setup took less than 30 mins for both boxes. Really happy with the results I now have full bars everywhere in my house. Also to mention these come with a bundled Tenda app which really comes in handy to log into the router and change settings.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Carrigan

customer_reviews.title: VERY bad piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Failed to connect to my wifi. It is irremovable as not listed in programs. Ended up having to factory reset both my computers.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Ultra fast
customer_reviews.text: Great value router. I receive on average about 277 MB/s download and 213 MB/s upload on this. Perfect for gaming and high data transfers
customer_reviews.author: Chinwe K.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! the best router, great speed, range and style looks futuristics. It is really great tor big houses 🏠 and AMAZING PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: lolnmo133

customer_reviews.title: Works well with the Virgin Superhub 3
customer_reviews.text: Router has worked very well. Currently have the virgin media superhub 3 which has had plenty of problems with dropped connections and speed. Using this router and placing the router in modem only mode and worked for me. Only Downside is that it did not increase the WiFi range as much as I expected it to. To note: all I did was swap the virgin superhub 3 to modem only mode and this worked for me fine.
customer_reviews.author: Arjun Parekh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: For the price and what it does, it is definitely value for money! Boosted signal all over my home and even outside into the garden. Ping times when gaming over wifi have also dropped considerably!
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Gr8 product & quck delivery, just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play almost, boosted my signal for wi-fi upstairs. Also using Lan ports upstairs for kids Playstations. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: mark quinn

customer_reviews.title: Avoid for the moment.
customer_reviews.text: New admin password not saved. Hence unable to access admin console. Had to reset router to access management software via initialisation routine. The management software needs fine tuning. When I CHANGE a password, I EXPECT it to be CHANGED and not to revert back to factory supplied password. Going back to branded routers like ASUS, NETGEAR etc.
customer_reviews.author: Winston S Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Better wifi
customer_reviews.text: Yep happy with this, first off get laptop or pc to do , ive put virggin hub 3 as a modem link it to router and also put app onto phone
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Very good value and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a router to add to our connection that would allow us to use a fixed vpn connextion. Worked perfectly. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Filled the void in my wifi network, managed to penetrate about 3 thick walls to provide a near full signal. Very good signal, speed and features.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Signal not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. It supposed to boost up my wifi but it’s even lower than my Virgin Hub3. Easy to install though for other isps could be good
customer_reviews.author: Raz

customer_reviews.title: Good valve and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable performance and I've used a few of these as both routers and repeaters. Signal range a little underwhelming but it's fine at this price point and good value.
customer_reviews.author: John-101

customer_reviews.title: slow and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: used this to try and boost terrible wifi speed on a virgin router, to some extent it managed that, but with slow lan connection I could not work from home.
customer_reviews.author: Wow

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Needed wifi upstairs as the sky router isn't strong enough, easy to set up, Ethernet lead from my sky router to this one. Set up the router on my phone for the network name and password. and now I have good wifi upstair and 3 Ethernet point for my pc and that.
customer_reviews.author: mr C P James

customer_reviews.title: Worst Router to go for
customer_reviews.text: If anyone looking to get this please stay away if you have any device that uses 2.4 Ghz bandwidth. Probably first 1 or 2 months you won't have issue as it get's older trust me you will have a lot issue on connecting a new device to the router and accessing the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Ziaur Rahman

customer_reviews.title: Best of best
customer_reviews.text: After trying few expensive and market leading routers such as ASUS and Draytek. For £35 this router will put the shame on them for both signal strength and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: delshad

customer_reviews.text: Great little router very easy to set up since having it as a second router for up stairs we got wifi in the house
customer_reviews.author: jdb

customer_reviews.title: OK but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Really good at first then wifi signal started to weaken needed rebooting every other day or so
customer_reviews.author: Erkan E.

customer_reviews.title: A good value router
customer_reviews.text: This router was not too difficult to set up and is a big improvement over the router which service provider sent us.
customer_reviews.author: RCS

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: Good router with good signal strength. Nice and easy to set up.. and wall mountable
customer_reviews.author: lee harper

customer_reviews.title: Strong 5GhZ signal even across the street!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. The only pity is that it won't allow IP pinhole to get around firewall (although allowing DMZ for all ports).
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Chi Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in the shed that we use as a gym at the bottom of the garden. Needed to be decent speed for using with zwift and YouTube, it hasn't disappointed. Well worth the money. I ran an ethernet cat 5e cable from the main modem in the house to it and it's been fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: joe marks

customer_reviews.title: Spend your money on a known brand !
customer_reviews.text: Not very good , poor connection speed and mine broke after about a week had to return ,
customer_reviews.author: DirtyDozen12

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi for not much money.
customer_reviews.text: If your Plusnet router is giving you WiFi problems, then get one of these. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Longshaw

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money as no improvement with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. The only positive thing I can say but The speed is exactly the same with my virgin media compal modem. Wifi Signal from dead spot are both the same as my virgin modem and this tenda router. No improvement at all. Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: FFF

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Had to return was not fit for purpose. Kept bringing up all varieties of security issues on devices
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be plugged directly into phone socket
customer_reviews.text: This product has no modem built in you will need a modem if you wish to to use a phone Socket to connect to internet!!
customer_reviews.author: Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Super Crab
customer_reviews.text: Feels cheap, but it works straight out the box, you can even copy your existing details from your old router, I'm using mine as an access point for a Phone modem, signal is much better all around the home.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok but do notice drops. Better than my network provided router's wifi signal.
customer_reviews.author: Tony McEvoy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job of extending our net to garden
customer_reviews.author: trevor groen

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The signal range no different from my vodafone 4 years old router with no antenna
customer_reviews.author: Saimir Hebovija

customer_reviews.title: Good router at a good price but does not actually support sharing a USB printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to take over from my Virgin super hub 3 and it works great, looks cool and was pretty cheap. I'm pretty disappointed though that despite this product page clearly saying "AC10U has multi-function USB interface, it supports sharing storage and printing server extensions" this is not the case and it only appears to support storage sharing
customer_reviews.author: Tabby Cromarty

customer_reviews.title: Pay for what you get i suppose
customer_reviews.text: The wifi isn't the strongest. I have a "low" and "fair" signal only downstairs in a small house. Also the speed of the internet is lost when going through this. Through virgin hub i got 386mbps through this 78mbps
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: apparently its very good!
customer_reviews.text: BUT, i had to return as it doesn't work with crappy SKY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really good
customer_reviews.text: i ordered it as i am working from home and needed it asap. it came the following morning and setup took less than 3 minutes so easy to set up and to connect wifi strength has never been better in the further areas of the house - really recommend
customer_reviews.author: Clare 111

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. great features. App works perfectly. Take control of your wifi with this great product
customer_reviews.author: Antony

customer_reviews.title: Tenda review
customer_reviews.text: It take me to setup 5 min. Just to be clear is not a Router. I need a repeater and a switch in my room this is perfect. You can setup in the same IP rage of router or create a new network .
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Advertising is incorrect
customer_reviews.text: This model is advertised as being capable of delivering 600Mb/s however this untrue, with a 300Mb/s everywhere else in my house when connected to this router it was only capable of getting 90Mb/s at most.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Wilson-Hall

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Worse than original router, didn’t boost the signal. Sent this item back and got a refund. Couldn’t review unless at least one star was allocated. For us I wouldn’t give it one star even.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: A very good router with an easy program to control who uses the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Taha

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Only configured the router today on ethernet wired on a 100mb connection I getting 100mb all over the house no dead rooms at all.wireless I still get 50 to 60 all over not bad for £33.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great value router and is installed in my mancave as an extension to my existing system.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Ryley

customer_reviews.title: easy tp use
customer_reviews.text: i used it as a dummy repeater however please remeber that its 10/100mbps LAN ports NOT gigabit.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: I’m not very happy
customer_reviews.text: Every hours all the device is disconnected from WiFi and connected again ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Boom. Problem solved. Suffered for years with poor wifi. I can not recommend this product enough. Simple set up.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: purchased to provide better signal for multiple devices that the Virgin Super Hub 3. Very pleased with the result. Better coverage and speed throughout the house
customer_reviews.author: Prof

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time invest in another router
customer_reviews.text: Signal was not very strong and was unable to use multiple devices at once as claimed
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Instable connection
customer_reviews.text: Power is good, but the connection is unstable for a device which is not the cheapest
customer_reviews.author: Massimo Vassalli

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. No paging at all. You can control it from the app.
customer_reviews.author: gotta toshiba

customer_reviews.title: It's easy enough to setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 1 month ago it was easy enough to setup and it is right but my isp is extremely low so I have really high ping in fortnite
customer_reviews.author: Teige fox

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: Very light, lots of antennas that are not baby or dog friendly! Very simple, basic network hub. Not very robust, but it works!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great software, instructions and super simple to setup
customer_reviews.text: Using as an access point plugged into Wifi extenders. Setup took about 30 seconds using the URL on the router. The web interface is top-tier.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver McGough

customer_reviews.title: tenda router
customer_reviews.text: good product , not expensive, signal wiffi strong, good coverage
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality , just 4 months old then it going on the bin .
customer_reviews.author: khanh

customer_reviews.title: Good range of signal
customer_reviews.text: This router is of good quality easy to set up and reliable in signal strength
customer_reviews.author: Ray Bates

product_meta.title: Tenda AC10U AC1200 Dual Band Gigabit Wireless Cable Router, a USB 2.0 Port, MU-MIMO, 4 Gigabit LAN Ports, 867Mbps/5 GHz+ 300Mbps /2.4GHz, Support VPN Server, WiFi Schedule, Power-saving
feature_bullets: High Wireless Speed: Simultaneous 2.4GHz 300Mbps and 5GHz 867Mbps connections for 1.2Gbps of total available bandwidth
Wider Wireless Coverage: 5 dBi omni-directional antennas, balancing the signal field and gain, providing you with stronger WiFi signals
Full Gigabit Ethernet ports (10/100/1000Mbps): Removing the bottleneck of wired ports speed
A USB Port: Quickly share a printer locally and files and digital media on your network
Smart management via the Tenda app: With the Tenda wifi app, you can manage network access from anywhere, anytime, and smart WiFi planning can turn WiFi on / off automatically
Package including: Tenda AC10U AC1200 Dual-Band Gigabit Wi-Fi router, power adapter, Quick install guide, Ethernet cable
24/7 Customer Support: If you have further questions about this product or want to clarify a technical detail before you purchase, please call +44 8000 418 955 or email support.uk@tenda.cn
